newsitem.title: CHINA: China curbs foreign travel of late tax payers.
newsitem.headline: China curbs foreign travel of late tax payers.

text.p: Chinese authorities issued regulations on Friday to curb the ability of people to leave the country who are in arrears over tax payments, the Xinhua news agency said.

The regulation issued jointly by the General Administration of Taxation and the Ministry of Public Security was aimed at tightening up on payment of taxes by foreigners engaged in business in China, Xinhua said.
The regulations would also be used to crack down on tax evasion by Chinese who are able to travel abroad, it said.

The tax authorities are empowered to warn those in arrears not to leave the country, while the police are authorised to prevent people leaving the copuntry who are in possession of an exit permit, it said.
If business organisations delay payment of taxes, their representatives would not be permitted to leave China, it said.
